page.title: 04Wild Life: Poems.
page.content: {The Buzzard A buzzard clumsy before flight, But when it is in the sky Is a graceful sight, With it's eagle like eyes And ripping beak and sharp talons Ready to catch a rabbit or mouse. It's spotted something. Down it flies To catch it's prey before it goes. {The Heron} The heron flies majestically, Perhaps clumsily at take off But once it's in the air It glides over the marsh Then when it lands, It skilfully plucks fish Out of the river. To me (the poet) It's definetely my favourite bird, I don't know about you.
